A handful of unfathomably powerful beings—called The Primal Players—passed eternity by inventing increasingly complex “games.” They weren’t gods. They were bored.

nodes.summary: CIVILIZED HEARTLANDS ARCANE CODEX — EXPANDED EDITION Arcane Lore  Magical Systems  Historical Spellcraft  Regional Theory Arcane Foundations of the Heartlands The Heartlands are the oldest cradle of structured magic in Thaos. Their arcane foundations trace back to pre-Runic civilizations whose earliest enchantments were shaped by necessity—protection, cultivation, healing, and communication.

nodes.summary: Culture & Social Structure: Hybrids rarely possess unified cultures; instead they form micro■clades, wandering kinships, experimental enclaves, or instinct-driven packs. nodes.name: Over centuries these simple sparks evolved into proto-academic traditions
nodes.summary:
Over centuries, these simple sparks evolved into proto-academic traditions. The Heartlands became the first region to institutionalize spellcraft, forming the Arkanite Lexicon: a standardized glyph-language used by scholars, bureaucrats, and artisans.
This chapter explores leyline stabilization, the emergence of the Auraline Schools, and the evolution of civic spell-regulation. Magical primers ens...

nodes.summary:
THAOS_CATEGORIZED.txt contains all lines from the cleaned and deduplicated
master codex (THAOS_MASTER_COMBINED_DEDUPE.txt) that could be matched to 
specific worldbuilding categories. This file organizes the extracted lore 
into major thematic groups to make it easier to navigate, analyze, and expand.
